title: Trump Organization CANCELS upcoming fundraiser at Mar-a-Lago booked by 'anti-Muslim hate group'
text:
The Trump Organization says it has canceled a $1,500-per-person fundraising gala that was scheduled to be held by an ‘anti-Muslim hate group’ at the president’s Mar-a-Lago club in Palm Beach.

An organization known as ACT for America had been promoting a November 7 fundraiser on its web site.

But a spokesperson for the Trump Organization told the Palm Beach Post on Sunday that ‘this group absolutely will not be hosting their event at Mar-a-Lago.’

ACT for America bills itself as ‘the nation’s largest and most influential national security grassroots advocacy organization.’

ACT for America was founded by Brigitte Gabriel, a Christian woman from Lebanon who moved to the United States in 1989

Michelle Malkin, the prominent conservative commentator, was scheduled to deliver the keynote address

Claiming to have a membership of 1 million people, it says it ‘stands for the protection of the United States of America, and the Western values upon which our nation was built.’

ACT for America promoted the November 7 fundraiser on its web site, but no explanation was given for its cancellation

The group placed ads on its web site promoting the Mar-a-Lago fundraiser, which was scheduled to feature conservative commentator Michelle Malkin as the keynote speaker.

But a day after news reports about the event were circulated, the Trump Organization emailed media outlets saying that the fundraiser would not be taking place.

No explanation was given for the cancellation.

Ibrahim Hooper, a spokesperson for the Council on American-Islamic Relations, a group that advocates on behalf of American Muslims, told the Post that he was surprised by the decision to cancel the fundraiser.

‘It’s something we obviously welcome,’ Hooper said.

‘I think the administration did the right thing. Cooler heads prevailed.’

On Saturday, Hooper slammed the event before learning of its cancellation.

‘It is totally inappropriate that an Islamophobic hate group would be in effect funneling money to the president of the United States by holding an event in one of his properties,’ he told the Post.

ACT for America, which is based in Washington, DC, has been labeled a hate group by anti-racism watchdogs including the Southern Poverty Law Center and the Anti-Defamation League.

The group promotes conspiracy theories about supposed Muslim plots to infiltrate America in order to impose Sharia (or Islamic religious law).

The organization was founded in 2007 by Brigitte Gabriel, a Christian woman from Lebanon who emigrated to the United States in 1989.

ACT for America, a group considered by some to be an anti-Muslim hate organization, will not be hosting a fundraiser at President Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate (seen above) in Palm Beach, Florida

Gabriel has been quoted as saying that a devout Muslim ‘cannot be a loyal citizen to the United States of America.’

She claims that ACT for America is ‘fighting for the preservation of our Judeo-Christian culture where everybody can be free and do whatever they want to do as long as they respect the constitution and agree that everyone is equal under the law.’

On its web site, the group rejects accusations that it supports bigotry.

‘ACT for America has never, and will never, tolerate any bias, discrimination, or violence against anyone, based on their religion, gender, race, or political persuasion,’ the group says.

‘Freedom to practice one's religion in peace is afforded to each of us by the U.S. Constitution and we will defend it vigorously.’

A number of prominent Republicans have appeared at ACT for America events, including Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, Congressman Peter King, Senator Ted Cruz, Congressman Steven King, and former National Security Adviser Michael Flynn.
description: ACT for America, a 'national security grassroots organization,' was founded by Brigitte Gabriel (pictured), a Lebanese Christian woman who immigrated to the U.S. in 1989.
